reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Empowering women through income generation skills for sustainable livelihoods phase 2

description.narrative: This project targets women?s income-generation groups in all four regions of Swaziland: Hhohho Lubombo Manzini and Shiselweni. It benefits from the Martha Association's previous experience of training of home economists both in Finland and in Sub-Saharan A frica. The partnership between the Martha Association and the University of Swaziland aims at creating a sustainable model for inservice training for Swazi home economists (HEEOs). The HEEOs in turn serve the communities that carry out income generating ac tivites in the field of home economics in all regions of the country. In the previous phase of the project (2013-2015) 24 groups ? six per region ? were assisted. The Home Economics Extension Officers who have been working closely with these groups have no w identified the most suitable ones for the next phase of the project (2016-2018). These are four groups per region making a total of 16 groups which will be assisted in up-scaling their income-generation activities. The direct beneficiaries would be about 240 (16 groups with average of 15 members per group). Other direct beneficiaries of the project are Home Economics Extension Officers (HEEOs) who are now 31with the latest recruits in Swaziland. The project also has several indirect beneficiaries. These a re family members of the assisted groups amounting to 1200 persons and increased revenues are expected to affect their wellbeing. The long-term development objective is increased wellbeing of beneficiaries and their families. The project?s immediate object ives are to: increase income for sixteen women?s groups increase awareness of good nutrition and women?s rights and improve skills of HEEOs and the UNISWA project team to work effectively for the development of the communities.Organizing Trainings of Train ers community trainings facilitating entry to the markets producing training material for communities and organizing project management training are the project?s main activities to address the project?s immediate objectives.
